text: Chondrosteus is an extinct genus of ray-finned fish from the family Chondrosteidae that lived during the Lower Jurassic. It has a single species, C. acipenseroides. It is related to modern-day sturgeons and paddlefish. == Description == Chondrosteus had a robust, shark-like body that was 1 meter long. Bizarrely, the ribs were missing. The basibranchial bone is ossified and the skin was not covered with scales. == Synonyms == * †Chondrosteus crassior Egerton, 1858 * †Chondrosteus pachyurus Egerton, 1858 == Gallery == == References == # Hilton, Eric J. (2009). "Redescription of Chondrosteus acipenseroides Egerton, 1858 (Acipenseriformes, Chondrosteidae) from the Lower Lias of Lyme Regis (Dorset, England), with comments on the early evolution of sturgeons and paddlefishes".
